intro: Leptodermis venosa, commonly known as the veiny skin plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, veined leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in inflorescences, and are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Leptodermis venosa is adapted to humid environments and is often found in forest understories where it thrives in partial shade.
